title: Passed from Death to Life
subtitle: The final revelation: you can no longer be 'un-born'

key_verse.text: Very truly I tell you, whoever hears my word and believes him who sent me has eternal life and will not be judged but has crossed over from death to life.

cards.title: The Moment of Revelation
cards.subtitle: Connecting all the previous studies
cards.content:
We have traveled a profound journey from Gethsemane to the opened tombs:

1Ô∏è‚É£ GETHSEMANE: Jesus sweat blood under the pressure of the cup
2Ô∏è‚É£ THE SUPPER: He established the New Covenant as Testator
3Ô∏è‚É£ THE CROSS: He drank the cup of wrath and was forsaken
4Ô∏è‚É£ THE VEIL: It tore from top to bottom - access opened
5Ô∏è‚É£ THE TOMBS: They opened - the saints were raised

üîë THE FINAL QUESTION:

Can someone who is 'born again' LOSE their salvation?

üí° THE REVELATION FROM THE RESURRECTED SAINTS:

When we saw that God did NOT raise Abraham, David and Isaiah to have them 'get lost' afterward, the Holy Spirit revealed something profound:

'God didn't raise them to test them again. He raised them because their salvation was already SEALED. If they could be lost, God wouldn't have invested His resurrection power in them.'

‚ú® THE CONNECTION:

If PHYSICAL RESURRECTION is irreversible...
Won't SPIRITUAL RESURRECTION also be?

üìñ JOHN 5:24:

'Whoever hears my word... HAS CROSSED OVER from death to life.'

The key word here is METABEBƒíKEN (Strong G3327).
cards.revelation_key: When you were born again, you became today's 'resurrected saints.' You are no longer in the tomb of sin. You already CROSSED OVER. It's irreversible.

cards.title: Metabebƒìken: The Perfect Tense of Salvation
cards.subtitle: Why it's a permanent legal transfer
cards.content:
John 5:24 - 'HAS CROSSED OVER (metabebƒìken) from death to life.'

üîç ANALYSIS OF METABEBƒíKEN (Strong G3327):

‚Ä¢ META = Change of place, transfer
‚Ä¢ BEBƒíKEN = Verb 'baino' (to go, walk)
‚Ä¢ Tense: PERFECT

üìö THE PERFECT TENSE IN GREEK:

It's the MOST POWERFUL verb tense in Greek:
‚Ä¢ Action that occurred in the PAST
‚Ä¢ Whose effects REMAIN in the present
‚Ä¢ And continue toward the FUTURE

It's not 'is crossing over' (present continuous).
It's not 'will cross over' (future).
It's 'already CROSSED OVER and the effects are permanent.'

üöö THE TRANSFER ILLUSTRATION:

Imagine you lived in the 'Kingdom of Death':
‚Ä¢ Citizenship: sinner
‚Ä¢ King: Satan
‚Ä¢ Destiny: eternal separation

When you were born again, you didn't improve your situation in that kingdom.
You were TRANSFERRED to another kingdom:

Colossians 1:13 - 'For he has rescued us from the dominion of darkness and brought us into the kingdom of the Son he loves.'

‚Ä¢ New citizenship: saint
‚Ä¢ New King: Christ
‚Ä¢ New destiny: eternal life

‚öñÔ∏è IT'S A LEGAL TRANSFER:

It doesn't depend on:
‚úó Your daily emotions
‚úó Your spiritual performance
‚úó Your ups and downs

It depends on:
‚úì The death of the Testator (validated the will)
‚úì Your faith in Christ (made you an heir)
‚úì The seal of the Holy Spirit (guarantee)

üîí EPHESIANS 1:13-14:

'You were marked in him with a SEAL, the promised Holy Spirit, who is a deposit GUARANTEEING our inheritance.'

DEPOSIT (arrabon - G728):
‚Ä¢ Down payment that GUARANTEES the full payment
‚Ä¢ Like a house deposit
‚Ä¢ Legally binding

If God gave the Spirit as 'down payment,' do you think He won't complete the transaction?

greek_words.meaning: Has crossed over, has been transferred (perfect tense)
greek_words.revelation: It's not an ongoing process. It's an accomplished fact. You already CROSSED OVER. Your legal position changed permanently at the moment of belief.
The Holy Spirit in you is God's 'signature' that He will complete what He began. It's not a loan; it's a legal commitment.

greek_words.meaning: To seal, mark with an official seal
greek_words.revelation: In the ancient world, the king's seal was unbreakable. You were sealed with the Spirit. No one can break that seal except God, and He won't.

cards.revelation_key: Metabebƒìken is the perfect tense: You already crossed over. You're not 'trying to cross.' You won't 'cross if you persevere.' You already CROSSED. Permanently.

cards.title: You Cannot Be Un-Born
cards.subtitle: Why the new birth is irreversible
cards.content:
John 3:3 - 'Very truly I tell you, no one can see the kingdom of God unless they are BORN AGAIN.'

üë∂ THE LOGIC OF BIRTH:

Can a baby be 'un-born'?

They can:
‚úì Get sick
‚úì Disobey
‚úì Distance themselves from their parents
‚úì Rebel against their family

But they CANNOT:
‚úó Lose their DNA
‚úó Stop being a child
‚úó Be 'un-born' from their family

üß¨ THE CHANGED NATURE:

2 Corinthians 5:17 - 'Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, the NEW CREATION has come: The old has gone, the new is here!'

KAINƒí KTISIS (New Creation):
‚Ä¢ Not 'improved'
‚Ä¢ Not 'renewed'
‚Ä¢ NEW - something that didn't exist before

üìä THE DIFFERENCE:

RELIGION:
‚Ä¢ Tries to IMPROVE the old nature
‚Ä¢ Like painting a coffin with colors
‚Ä¢ Death remains inside

GOSPEL:
‚Ä¢ God KILLS the old nature
‚Ä¢ Gives you a NEW nature
‚Ä¢ 'I have been crucified with Christ' (Gal 2:20)

üîë ROMANS 8:9-10:

'You, however, are not in the realm of the flesh but are in the realm of the Spirit, if indeed the Spirit of God LIVES in you. And if anyone does not HAVE the Spirit of Christ, they do not belong to Christ.'

The proof of salvation:
‚Ä¢ Is NOT your moral perfection
‚Ä¢ Is NOT your biblical knowledge
‚Ä¢ IS the presence of the Holy Spirit in you

If the Spirit DWELLS (oike≈ç - permanently inhabits) in you, you belong to Christ.

‚ö†Ô∏è THE WARNING:

1 John 2:19 - 'They went out from us, but they did not really BELONG to us. For if they had belonged to us, they would have remained with us.'

The person who 'loses' their salvation never had it.
The person who was 'born again' cannot be un-born.

scripture_connections.text: I give them eternal life, and they shall never perish; no one will snatch them out of my hand. My Father... no one can snatch them out of my Father's hand
Neither height nor depth, nor anything else in all creation, will be able to separate us from the love of God
Being confident of this, that he who began a good work in you will carry it on to completion until the day of Christ Jesus
If we are faithless, he remains faithful, for he cannot disown himself

cards.revelation_key: Salvation doesn't depend on your ability to hold on to God. It depends on God's ability to hold on to you. And He doesn't let go.

cards.title: What About Deliberate Sin?
cards.subtitle: Distinguishing between discipline and condemnation
cards.content:
ü§î THE COMMON OBJECTION:

'But Hebrews 10:26 says: If we deliberately keep on sinning after we have received the knowledge of the truth, no sacrifice for sins is left.'

Does this contradict eternal security?

üìñ THE CONTEXT OF HEBREWS 10:

The author is speaking about people who:
‚Ä¢ Knew the gospel intellectually
‚Ä¢ But consciously REJECTED Christ
‚Ä¢ Returned to the Old Covenant sacrificial system
‚Ä¢ Never experienced the new birth

It's not about a believer who falls into sin.
It's about someone who never truly believed.

üîë THE DIFFERENCE:

CHILD WHO SINS:
‚úì Experiences conviction from the Holy Spirit
‚úì Suffers fatherly discipline (Heb 12:6)
‚úì Is eventually restored
‚úì Doesn't lose their position as a child

STRANGER WHO PRETENDS:
‚úó Has no internal conviction
‚úó Progressively hardens their heart
‚úó Finally abandons the profession of faith
‚úó Proves they were never a child (1 John 2:19)

‚öñÔ∏è DISCIPLINE vs. CONDEMNATION:

Romans 8:1 - 'Therefore, there is now no CONDEMNATION for those who are in Christ Jesus.'

Hebrews 12:6 - 'The Lord DISCIPLINES the one he loves.'

‚Ä¢ CONDEMNATION = Final legal punishment (hell)
‚Ä¢ DISCIPLINE = Temporary loving correction (restoration)

If you're a child, you'll never experience condemnation.
But you WILL experience discipline when you sin.

üéØ 1 JOHN 3:9:

'No one who is born of God will CONTINUE to sin, because God's seed remains in them; they CANNOT go on sinning, because they have been born of God.'

‚Ä¢ 'CONTINUE' (poie≈ç) = to do continually as a lifestyle
‚Ä¢ Doesn't say you'll never fall
‚Ä¢ Says you can't LIVE comfortably in sin

The true child can fall, but CANNOT remain fallen without conviction.
cards.identity_statement: Eternal security is not a license to sin. It's the foundation for true sanctification. You don't obey from fear of losing salvation, but from gratitude for having received it.
cards.revelation_key: If you can sin deliberately without any conviction or discomfort, the question isn't 'can I lose my salvation?' but 'was I ever born again?'

discovery_questions.question: Do you live with the certainty that you 'already CROSSED OVER from death to life' (perfect tense), or with the uncertainty that you're 'trying to cross' (present continuous)?
Do you obey God from FEAR of losing your salvation, or from GRATITUDE because your salvation is secure? What's your real motivation?
Is there evidence of the Holy Spirit dwelling in you? Do you experience conviction when you sin? Or can you live in sin without discomfort?
If your salvation depended on your ability to 'hold on' to God, how long would you last? But if it depends on God holding on to you, how does that change your confidence?

prayer.title: Prayer of Certainty
prayer.content: Heavenly Father, today I understand with crystal clarity that my salvation is not a fragile process. It's an ACCOMPLISHED FACT. I already CROSSED OVER (metabebƒìken - perfect tense) from death to life. I'm not 'trying to cross.' I won't 'cross if I behave.' I already CROSSED. Like the saints who came out of their tombs in Matthew 27, I came out of my 'spiritual tomb' when You gave me life. And just as You didn't raise them to lose them, You didn't save me to lose me. Forgive my unbelief when I live in fear of 'losing' what You already sealed with the Holy Spirit. Help me to obey not from fear of condemnation, but from gratitude for adoption. I'm not an employee on probation. I'm a SON with a guaranteed inheritance. I cannot be 'un-born.' Thank You for Your unbreakable faithfulness. In Jesus' name, Amen.
